Description: Cypriot terracotta figure of man wearing crested helmet. Handmade in primitive style. Helmet has cheek plates and a tassel hanging down at the back. Head only. Pale buff fabric with fine black, red and white inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ16 or 17
Curator's comments: This helmet form was commonly found on models of chariot drivers from Cyprus dated to the Cypro-Archaic period (Karageorghis 1995, pls 61.2, 61, 64, Types II(iii)d8-11), though these cannot be given a more refined date. Karageorghis, V. 1995. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. IV. The Cypro-Archaic Period small male figurines. Nicosia, University of Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.070) (Phase 1)
